N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 97.1 - Taxes on admissions

State Regulations
(a) Sections 219, 306, 406, 1007(3)(e), 1008(4)(b) and 1009(5) of the New York

State Racing, Pari-Mutuel Wagering and Breeding Law impose taxes equivalent to
four percent of the admission prices to running, harness and quarter horse race
meetings and the simulcasts thereof. (b) Each admissions tax must be paid to the

Department of Taxation and Finance within 10 days after the close of the race
meeting for which the admissions were charged. Provided, however, if a race
meeting continues for a period of more than 30 days, the tax must be paid on or
before the 10th day of each month for the previous month's
admissions. (c) The payment of tax
must be accompanied by a report showing the total amount of tax due and such
other information as the department may require therein. (d) If the applicable admissions tax is not
paid when due, a penalty of five percent and interest at the rate of one
percent per month from the due date to the date of payment of the tax shall be
payable to the department. Notes
